website_summaries.verdict: A veritable toolbox of a knife with an astounding 33 functions. Stainless steel construction.
pros: Functions include corkscrew, 3 blades, fish scaler, wire stripper, scissors, 5 types of screwdriver, ballpoint pen, wood saw, and more
cons: At 3.5 inches long and nearly 1.5 inches high, this is a fairly large and heavy knife to carry in your pocket

customer_reviews.title: Top qualify multi tool
customer_reviews.text: My dad owned a Swiss army knife when I was a kid and I constantly stole it from him due to how useful it was. This knife is no different. While there are a couple features I personally won't use (fish hook) there are a multitude of features that I will use while camping/hiking/backpacking. The qualify is exactly what you expect from a reputable brand. The knife comes in a small box and that's pretty much it. No complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: MelanieTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Must have owned knock off knives in the past because I'm blown away with the quality of this knife. Only con is I needed a large screw driver and there really isn't a large flat head like on my leatherman but this is a smaller knife. I used the 2 most useless tools at work! - The fish descaler to pry a door open because I didn't want to scratch any of the other tools - The hook to grab a sharp cable stuck in a machine. So if you are creative and quick thinking there are so many uses for this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Best purpose knife you can own
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Champion, and my 17th Victorinox knife. Gave them to my officers as Christmas gifts, and in my opinion, best foldable knife/tool you can buy for the money. They last forever... I have one from my father from the 50's and still functions as new. You'll never find me without a Victorinox knife in my pocket or on my belt
customer_reviews.author: colnajoe

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for misshipments.
customer_reviews.text: These are great knives, and would be a great gift for someone. The only thing is, when you order the $90+ SwissChamp knife in hardwood and you receive the $20 Tinker knife, something's lacking. Way to go Amazon. The label on the box even says "SwissChamp, Hardwood", to add insult to injury.
customer_reviews.author: Erik C. Deurmeier

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected greatness!!!! Great edc
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a big swiss army knife, so I purchased this. NOW IM HOOKED ON VICTORINOX!!! Extremely useful, I'm very impressed. Used to carrying leather and, I have a wave, surge, and signal. Theres a simple beauty to this swiss champ, it's so easy and quick to deploy, and capable. I now have purchased several other victorinox s.a.k. since and enjoy them immensely!
customer_reviews.author: Brendon

customer_reviews.title: The classics seldom change
customer_reviews.text: Nostalgia is a wonderful thing. I had purchased this very same model over thirty years ago, and it has succumbed to the ravages of use and time. It was refreshing to open the box and see a flawless case, all the accessories nicely in place, and a smoother-than-remembered action to the springs All in all, they've updated a few things, like the magnifying glass and retooled the file, but it's a solid piece and functions perfectly...all the tools you'll need in one lightweight place..
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed due to cosmetic defect, functionally seems fine.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted this knife for a while and finally bit the bullet when I saw it go on sale despite a 2 month backorder. I felt I could wait, so I placed my order and crossed my fingers. When it finally arrived, I was thrilled. Opened the package, came in a little box. Opened every tool, was wondering if I’ll ever use each tool that it has. When I looked at it closer, I realized that the front side with the logo was scuffed up. I’m sure that it would have gotten scuffed up from regular use later but for a brand new item to arrived scuffed up, I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ng

customer_reviews.title: Functional nostalgia - Just like I remember 20 years ago
customer_reviews.text: Nostalgia! I had one of these as a kid, and lost it over the next two decades. I’ve been on a quest to remember my youth and ran across this item. It’s just as I remembered. Sure the magnifying glass now has a clear surround rather than gray - who cares. The build quality is identical. As you use each of the tools, you will remember the attention to detail that made victorinox the only Swiss Army knife worth buying. Ibe even used it several times around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not Version Pictured (Wooden Scales)
customer_reviews.text: The wooden scales version does not have pen and pin. Now they also do not have tweezers. The scales are not as pictured. It is a darker wood and feels rough, not glossy. There are no tools at all on both scales. Very disappointed. I thought maybe Amazon sent wrong item by accident, but replacement and subsequent order also got different version from picture and description--definitely not 33 tools.
customer_reviews.author: drmannkh

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite SAK's
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this knife due to great reviews, the tool combination of the SwissChamp is close to perfect for my excursions into the woods for a day hike. The SwissChamp is a little bulky for pocket carry so I toss the knife into a backpack pocket, great for starting a small fire for lunch and removing splinters, the magnifying glass comes in handy when used with the tweezers. The pliers have been used a few times for light duty tasks like changing out or snugging down the jets on my MSR stove.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: I’ve wanted one since I was I kid.
customer_reviews.text: When I was a kid my cousin had a Swisschamp that I picked up almost every time I went in his room. I always wanted one. When I saw the black model for almost $30 less than retail of $79.99 I had to pull the trigger. It’s huge and not as practical and pocket friendly as my Victorinox Compact or even my Victorinox Deluxe Tinker, but I love it. I assume it will find a handy home in a tool box or my desk, like my cousin’s old one. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Pak

customer_reviews.title: Pay for quality
customer_reviews.text: I've always found the Swiss products to be study and reliable, but I liked the Wenger scissors MUCH better than the Victorinox approach, which is used it this knife. While the Leatherman products may have some better design features, the Swiss products were usually sturdier, especially when I used the scissors. Since Wenger is now owned by Victorinox, I'll have to see if the scissors improve. So far, not so encouraging. The pliers on the Leatherman are better, but it's bigger. If you are a building superintendent, probably buy the Leatherman. If you futz around the house and have a pair of pliers, you'll probably like the Swiss products better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, Yes, Yes!!
customer_reviews.text: I got a used Swiss Champ, saved about $15-$20, and you can't even tell it's used. Shipping was fast, and the knife is great! All the tools are in excellent shape and work as they should. I have many other SAK's, but this one is by far the largest with the greatest assortment of tools. I love the magnifier, and was blown away by how powerful and clear it was for being plastic. Better than most glass ones I own. Also the pliers have a great wire cutter that cut a pretty thick piece of wire (considering the size of the cutter) with no problem at all. Very clean and neat cut.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Schonfeld

customer_reviews.title: Finally arrived
customer_reviews.text: Long story short. I forgot to place my Victorinox pocket knife on my bag when I was taking a plane, so yeah, I had to hand it over to the security officer, and for the last 4 months I felt naked, so I decided it was time to buy a replacement, so I bought this one. Couldn't be happier, It's an upgrade from my last tool, this one has the magnifying glass, the extra screwdrivers, the ruler, the pen and probably a couple more features. True Victorinox, top quality, 100% satisfied. Hopefully won't lose it again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-tool for Anyone
customer_reviews.text: I purchase 2 of these a year along with other Swiss Army variants to hand out as gifts to friends, family, & Competition Prizes. The options and uses of the swisschamp is boundless. The durability and design along with the famous Victorinox Quality provides you a multi-tool for a lifetime. Opinion Only: The Sapphire Blue is an amazing Color and looks even better in person!
customer_reviews.author: BetaTech

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and effective
customer_reviews.text: I carry this around everywhere. I’ve had it for around a month and I’ve used it to cut up an vegetables are lunch, open boxes, pry up laminate tiles, file nails, remove a splinter, write a quick note, build a piece of gym equipment, look at an ant, pick my teeth, crack open a cold beer, cut open a package, scrape a fire starter, fix a loose door handle, etc. All in all. A great tool just to carry around. You never know when you need it. I would recommend opening everything up once and a while and familiarize yourself with what is there. Sometimes I forget.
customer_reviews.author: Grey

customer_reviews.title: Victronix Multi tool
customer_reviews.text: Victronix Swiss army knifes among my favorites. Always good quality and has all the gadgets. Only a couple models have more goodies than this knife. I have actually used almost all tools and never had a problem with this or any of my Victronix knifes. The only issue I have had is loosing the tooth pic/Tweezers inserts. Replacements easily found.
customer_reviews.author: Papa254

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but 4/5
customer_reviews.text: As a few people mentioned it's a great tool but if you happen to collect them or just have a thing about cosmetic issues you should be cautious. Mine arrived in a swiss army box as other photos here show and the tools came in fine without any issues accessing them but the scales had scratches on both sides as if used which is not a massive issue but if it is marked as a brand new product it shouldn't be an issue to begin with. Scratches aside it's extremely comfortable in hand for how many tools it has though for the same reason I'd recommend buying a case as it does have some weight to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely destructive saw, good magnifying lens, everything is useful on a camping trip
customer_reviews.text: The saw is very destructive. It can saw through a log 7cm in diameter in less than 10 minutes, and severely weaken logs up to 10cm in diameter. The magnifying lens is just right for finding splinters and debris in shallow wounds (depth<8mm). The metal saw can cut through anything weaker than iron and steel, given the material is of feasible thickness. The blades are quite well constrained in position when deployed. You still need to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: The Swiss Can Fix It
customer_reviews.text: Every man needs a Swiss Army knife in his life. I keep one in my glove box for all of life's little emergencies. We've used these things to do everything from cut birthday wrapping paper en route to a party, to cutting gauze for a bandage, unscrewing a flashlight battery cover, and tweezing splinters. There are other multi-tools that might do some of these tasks, but there are few situations this thing can't help you with.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conradt

customer_reviews.title: It really compliments the Leatherman Super Tool 300
customer_reviews.text: The Swiss Champ has things I really need that either my Leatherman Super Tool 300 lacks or that is has, but not as good as what the Swiss Champ has. For example, the Swiss Champ has things like a cork screw, functional scissors, and other things the Super Tool 300 doesn't have, however while both have can openers, the Swiss Champ's are superior, but that goes for any Swiss tool can opener. Swiss also has better bottle openers. All in all the Swiss Champ is fulfilling its role of working with my Super Tool 300, each complimenting the strengths and shoring up the weaknesses of the other.
customer_reviews.author: Einar

customer_reviews.title: This is a genuine Victorinox knife
customer_reviews.text: I finally caved in after 30 years of wanting this knife. I read through the instruction manual and found there was a stick pin in the knife. I went to a swiss army knife fanboy website and found the pin is located by the corkscrew. Your can see the head of the pin against the casing. If I had not skimmed the instruction booklet I would never have known about one of the better features of the knife - magnifying glass + stick pin = splinter removal
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gingerich

customer_reviews.title: I love my SwissChamp
customer_reviews.text: If you are on the fence about this product, stop hesitating and get this now! I love my SwissChamp. The wood finish is very classy and fits perfectly with an outdoor style. Pro-tip: I used a spray on finisher (from Home Depot spray paint section) to seal the wood. It provides a nice glossy look, adds a nice touch effect and protects the wood. I've only had this for a couple weeks, but have already used it to resize the links on a wristwatch, cut tags from retail items, slice twine in the backyard, tighten some flathead and philips heads around the house and, most importantly cork a bottle of wine and open up some beers!
customer_reviews.author: Rob O.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lost my blue one that I had since 2012 this weekend in the woods 😥. Had to get a new one since I use this everyday to cut fruit etc. it's legit not a fake. I love this knife. But I'm still mad I lost my other. Oh well. Red is sweet too.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very handy, great looks.
customer_reviews.text: My husband had been talking about this pocket knife for years but never purchased it. I finally decided to get it for him for Father's Day and let me tell you, I don't think I could have gotten a better gift. It's been over three weeks and he's still boasting about every single part of it. He loves the wood and he loves all the tools. He says that it is the best Swiss Army knife he's ever had, and he has about 8 of them. You may think that's excessive, but he just had not found the perfect one... until​ now.
customer_reviews.author: Janeth S.

customer_reviews.title: Best multi tool on the planet
customer_reviews.text: Best swiss army knife, I have em all and this is the big dog, definitely the best. Only gripe is the magnifying glass is a useless waste of space. Will not start a fire even on cotton balls and just suck in general. Every thing else top notch tho
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by Superior Handling During Use Over Other SAK's
customer_reviews.text: I hemmed and hawed on this purchase because of the weight of the Champ and what some have described as cartoony dimensions. However, after putting this knife to use over the past several weeks, it's actually easier to hold. The scissors, the saw, and the screwdrivers, for example, are more stable in hand, and as a result I get the job done more easily and quicker than with my Super Tinker. I was really surprised by this, and now prefer to reach for the Swiss Champ at home, plus I'd definitely take this one camping over any other.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousTop Contributor: Coffee Roasting

customer_reviews.title: Nothing else compares!
customer_reviews.text: Gave my first to my son 10 years ago. Purchased this when a close friend showed me his that was 30 years old and still looked new. I had forgotten how much I loved carrying mine. Ordered this one, a step up, and I have literally used it every day since. Every other multi tool I own has been resting in a tool box since.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Blakley

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well made, extremely useful multitooll
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute beast. Most useful tool i may have ever bought. If you keep this bad boy in your pocket, you'll be making your life easier. That being said, I bought it for backpacking/ camping and its great. Knives are sharp and the quality you'd expect from victorinox, as well as the scissor. Wrench is impressively strong for a little guy. All around would definitely recommend this multitool over most leathermans (unless you need the giant pliers).
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great as a gift
customer_reviews.text: This was such a hit at my father’s birthday party. He was blown away with all the many features and fine details! Totally worth the money. Its been over a month now and I still overhear him bragging about his Swiss knife with his friends. Basically, if you have zero clue what to get you father (or any male) do not hesitate to buy this army Swiss knife. They will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Keep grabbing this for my edc and I have dozens of multitool from all the big names
customer_reviews.text: It’s just the best edc I’ve ever had period, some people do gripe about the pliers being smaller than on butterfly fold out style multitools but these are actually very capable and for a 6oz tool it has everything but the kitchen sink
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: BEST DEPENDABLE SURVIVAL KNIFE FOR YOUR POCK
customer_reviews.text: I've USED THES TYPE OF KNIFES FOR 50 YEARS ON MY BIRTHDAY THIS YEAR. THEY HAVE ALWAY BEEN THE BEST OVER ALL KNIFE TO KEEP IN YOUR POCKET. I've USED IT IN BOYS SCOUT WHEN YOUNGER. USED IT FOR FISHING AND SMALL REPAIRS. I CARRIED ONE WITH ME WHEN I WAS IN THE ARMY, FOR prospecting AND WHEN I WAS AN EMT AND ON SEARCH AND RESCUE. THE ONLY WISH I HAVE IS TO BE ABLE TO AFFORD THE VICTORINOX 1.6795XAVT SWISS ARMY CHAMP XAVT POCKET KNIFE BEFORE I DIE. THAT WOULD BE A DREAM COME TRUE.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Swiss Army Knifes, the Rolex of the knife world!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this exact knife twenty five years ago and I think I paid $125 for it then. It was well used and served me well, but it finally started to fall apart, the plastic on the handles started falling off. I ordered the same exact model, and it was delivered in a timely manner, the knife s the same exact one, same great Swiss Quality, but I paid less then $100 for it. Not many things Swiss actually have lower prices then they did twenty five years ago, just look at Rolex watches for an example. Bottom line, Swiss Army Knifes are the Rolex of the Knife world. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Chazman1946Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Where's the case?
customer_reviews.text: A wicked piece of craftsmanship art especially with the blue scales but came with no belt sheath. I say again no belt sheath!! For the price of this item, it's kind of a kick to the jewels to have it come with no sheath. The knife itself is perfect and so to keep it perfect I'm forced to place it in a hermetically sealed vault instead of on my belt
customer_reviews.author: Paddy H

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool.
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this multi tool Swiss Champ. I originally purchased a red handled one. But I was sent a counterfeit one which I promptly sent back when I realized what a piece of garbage it was. It was sold by someone else but arranged by Amazon. I ordered this one even though it cost $39.00 more. It was sold By Amazon so i figured it wouldn't be a counterfeit. The Swiss Champ is such an awesome tool. I love the wood shields. The quality is first rate.There is no comparison to that "thing" that I was sent last week.
customer_reviews.author: Kanaheik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent makeshift nuclear bomb defuser / quarantine self-dentistry kit
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend that you do anything unsafe, but sometimes you find yourself in a life or death situation with nothing but the contents of your pockets, and it is at those times that you will wish that you had a pocket large enough for this folding toolchest. I've had many Victorinox knives/tools and they are always top-notch quality.
customer_reviews.author: XpertskiR

customer_reviews.title: Hope Victorinox returns to their old quality standards.
customer_reviews.text: I already own this item for 30 years. I wanted an extra one. The plastic frame around the magnifier is flimsy clear plastic. My old one has a tough resin type plastic frame. The first time I used the magnifier on this new one, the lens popped out. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: This was a knockoff and is not from the original company. I was unable to return this as I purchased it for a birthday gift and it sat in my closet for over a month before being given to the recipient. I spent the extra money and went directly to the company and you can tell without a shadow of a doubt that they are two very different knives.
customer_reviews.author: PotPie

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: After 25 years of thinking about upgrading from my woodsman i finally decided to get the champ. this was my dream pocket knife as a young boyscout. Now as my son has become a Fox Trailman in Trail Life USA he has taken a fascination with this amazing pocket knife and he will also own a swiss army knife soon as he becomes a Hawk Trailman
customer_reviews.author: rm

customer_reviews.title: Very very disappointing quality :(
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several Swiss Army knives over the years and have been quite satisfied with the quality. I was skeptical of the plastic parts on this one, especially the magnifier. And I was correct. Upon opening the box and inspecting the new Swiss Champ the lens from the magnifier fell out about 2 seconds into looking at it like something cheaply made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Scarcella

customer_reviews.title: This big knife repaces my old one...
customer_reviews.text: After I gave away my old Swiss Army knife (that I got in Switzerland in 1985) to the TSA on our trip to the Philippines, I asked for a replacement knife for my birthday. This knife is GREAT! It's a little heavy for my pocket, as it's bigger than the one I gave up. But I now have a pouch to carry it in too. After 30 years, the old blade was getting a little dull, so it's really nice to have a new dangerously pointy and sharp knife to fix all my problems around the house and out camping. (Oh, I can't WAIT to use it camping!)
customer_reviews.author: Strobel Family

customer_reviews.title: Better than my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful knife-set of tools. I expected that it might be difficult to open the blades and tools but they were relatively easy to open. I expected it would be unwieldy to hold. It had a better grip then my skinnier knives. Finally I expected the weight to be an issue. I was amazed that it didn't really feel heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Very practical
customer_reviews.text: Great product and it feels comfortable to use and durable to withstand any condition you may encounter and its slim enough that is comfortable to use very practical and good looking, and for all the functionalities it has is not that heavy excellent product you get your money worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Formula1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knife and functions but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time. 5 Stars for utility. 4 stars for quality. I wish the steel was a bit heavier, especially for the blade. Knife has a habit of collecting lint out of your pocket. Need to use an old toothbrush to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R.

customer_reviews.title: They need to start making the OLD S.O.S. case again.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything about how GREAT of a knife this is that hasn't already been said. Most definitely a 5 STAR knife. I only wish I could buy the S.O.S. case that they USED to make like 20 years ago, and be able to just buy the case. That would make a great knife greater.
customer_reviews.author: mike porinchak

customer_reviews.title: about as big as you'll ever need
customer_reviews.text: superbly made this is a great pocket knife. there are a ton of features on the swisschamp and it's about as big as you'd ever really want an everyday pocket knife to be.
customer_reviews.author: alpex

customer_reviews.title: Love this knife!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the SwissChamp. Really a bit skeptical of the positive reviews, but I love this knife! It has saved me many a trip to the toolbox!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first one in Switzerland in 1999. Served me very well for 20 years. I had to pack it in my bag for a flight and it was stolen... :( So this one is a replacement - it has only a couple of small differences from my original one. I am sure it will last another 20 years at least.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Thing.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very handy. I use the knife, scissor, toothpick, tweezer, small screwdriver for my eyeglasses, wine opener, beer opener and small pen a lot. Every guy needs to have this thing. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: tom nyc

customer_reviews.title: You will want this
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pocket knife I have ever used. I find that I have been using these tools on a frequent basis. I hate hunting for simple tools in my tool bag every time I need to fix something on the spot. So this has been very handy and accessible. I won't throw away my tool bag, but life has been easier when I need a handy device.
customer_reviews.author: PGK

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the best
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. I had this knife since 1996 and I used it heavily and it's still great. I just lost it recently and bought a new one immediately. One of the best products ever.
customer_reviews.author: Basam S.

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox Swisschamp
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Victorinox Swisschamp to replace my wife's swisschamp which had been damaged. You can't go wrong with a swisschamp, or any other Victorinox knife!
customer_reviews.author: P. Malamud

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. I bought it again to replace the one I had for many years until it was "borrowed." I use it nearly every day, carry it on my belt with the matching pouch (Swiss Army 33212 X-Large Zermatt Pouch). You have to be careful when using it because there is no lock on the tools—put pressure on them in the wrong direction and they can fold back and pinch or cut your hand. Five Stars despite this safety issue because of how endlessly useful it is.
customer_reviews.author: Fellrunner

customer_reviews.title: My Go To Device ...
customer_reviews.text: You cant beat owning one of these knives, I use it multiple times a week for many different purposes. I have even pulled out the ball point pen and used it to pass on phone numbers and also set my cars clock . You will not regret your purchase of the Victorinox Swiss Army Multi-Tool.
customer_reviews.author: R. D.

customer_reviews.title: A great tool.
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't as bulky as I had anticipated, which is really nice. It's still a thick knife. I bought it to replace a Victorinox Super Tinker that finally broke after 13 years of use including two USMC infantry deployments to Iraq and a trip to Africa. I used more than half of the tools on the SwissChamp within the first week on projects ranging from replacing an electrical outlet and fixing the tub drain to trimming tree branches and helping my neighbor fix an old motorcycle. Each tool is durable, functional, and opens and closes with a palpable snap. It's a great tool and not too big for the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Gil O'Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the original SwissChamp
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of the hardwood WWP logo knife: FYI it does not have the straight pin nor the pressurized ballpoint pen that come standard in the original SwissChamp knife. I don't think this is mentioned in here on the product description. I also did not like the quality of the so-called solid wood; it seemed very cheap to me. I'm therefore returning it and purchasing the original SwissChamp instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonoholic

customer_reviews.title: I feel it's a good way to introduce kids to knifes
customer_reviews.text: I have been into knifes my whole life. Now I'm a chef. Go Figure! This and the red one are for young Grandchildren. 10 and 7. I feel it's a good way to introduce kids to knifes , because there are more other tools for them to be fixated on. I bought the exact same knife, for my three boys years ago and they all have all their fingers! I have 5 Grand children these are for the oldest two. I have 5 boys and one Beautiful little girl! I wish they made these in pink!! But anyway she will get one!
customer_reviews.author: scott gooden

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox good knife multi tool.
customer_reviews.text: like every Victorinox knife, this reflects very good quality, the only thing is that the magnifying glass is plastic and I don't like that. the other thing is that for that price it should come in a case to carry on the leash and not in a carton box.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Andrés Valencia Tascón

customer_reviews.title: Great WWP Knife!
customer_reviews.text: Great pocket knife, the wood and engraved WWP symbol is very pretty. We did return it because it didn't have all the features my husband was looking for, for that price. Customer Service reps are very helpful and had great communication with me.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality you expect from a Vicorinox knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of them as a gift for my fiends. The first one had many scratches on one side on the knife and the other one had many debris on the wood saw! I've bought other models but never received them like this! It seems the quality is not as before!
customer_reviews.author: Amirhossein Herandi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love it, use it every day. A girl needed a nail file, I was on it and even got a kiss out of it. Come on, does it get better?
customer_reviews.author: william L Brown

customer_reviews.title: Swiss Army - The Champions of the do it all
customer_reviews.text: The name says it all, this knife is the champ of not only the swiss line but of any multipurpose knives available. I have been using this knife daily since I received it and love it. I went back and forth between the wood case and traditional plastic and I'm very glad I went with the wood. The quality of this knife exactly what I expected from Victorinox (Swiss Army). Bottom line this is something any home should have at least one of. Buy it, buy it right now.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's Victorinox, what more can I say. I've misplaced my old Swiss Army knife, and I'm sure it'll turn up some day, but I was kinda lost w.o. it. So I ordered this one with a few more features than my old one - glad to have them!
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT F WASSERMAN

customer_reviews.title: This is my "go to" gift for college kids
customer_reviews.text: I buy this as a gift to friends' kids that start college. I just bought the fifth a month ago. It is a handy tool to keep in their toolbox to tackle what college life throws at them. They all love it and tell me that they use it frequently. Perhaps, they are telling that to make me happy:) Regardless, it is my way of telling the kids that they can solve their little issues themselves. No need to call outside help for small chores. College is time to learn how stand on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Kutsal D

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Knife !!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this model of SwissChamp for decades and love it ! I usually replace them when I lose them. This time my old one was just beat, having been dropped multiple times, bending blades in the process...my bad, not the knifes. Best price I have ever paid, this one! I use the soft case and have it on my belt at all times. Buy it !
customer_reviews.author: Gary Randall

customer_reviews.title: Everything you expect.
customer_reviews.text: Item is fantastic, it's everything I've come to expect from a Victorinox Swiss Champ.... In blue. This item was a replacement for my previous Swiss Champ, which was lost, but which lasted me for 13 or 14 years without so much as a hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Almendarez

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived with scuff marks
customer_reviews.text: This item was ordered new, and the blades and utensils were in perfect condition. The plastic housing on the sides of this item were scuffed. I give this 3 stars due to the fact. I bought the black one so it is very noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Salads

customer_reviews.title: Best multi tool but does not have a locking blade
customer_reviews.text: This tool is the best Swiss knife on the market in my opinion. It has everything you would likely need. Victorinox is way superior than Wenger also. The only thing this tool is lacking, is a locking blade. So if you are looking for something that can be used as a weapon, this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: chris chau

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Victorinox product quality never disappoints. Sturdy, sharp and built very nice. I'm a bit disappointed with the packaging though, it's just the knife inside a thin box (with a hole punctured on one edge of it), and without the user's guide as well. The knife slides freely inside the box and scratches the scale. I don't know if Victorinox changed their packaging or something, because some unboxing videos on youtube show the knife box with a nice sliding mechanism and a user's guide. Something I'd expect from a premium brand like this. But that doesn't affect the usability and the quality of the knife in any way though — still a great SAK. I'd give 4.5 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Paulus Aldo Wahyudi

customer_reviews.title: Very worthy purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved knives especially the swiss army variety. This thing has so many cool things to tinker with. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: shane cawthon

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Has the tools I need and a a reasonable price. I buy several at a time because the TSA keeps taking them, but it's still worth it. I wish they came with a self addressed envelope so I could stop replacing them when I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Pigwillow

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Tried and True
customer_reviews.text: You know of Swiss Army Knives by name and that's because they're sturdy little tools that hold up well. I'm enjoying mine so far, and like the heft this model has. I haven't had any tools jam so far.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy C.

customer_reviews.title: Had scratches on the scale and main blade.
customer_reviews.text: It had scratches on the scale and blade and hence returned it. It’s other wise an amazing multi tool, one is the best from Victorinox.
customer_reviews.author: JVC

customer_reviews.title: must have
customer_reviews.text: everyone in my family (women too) carry one of this model. I give them as gifts to anyone I like who doesn't have one. I use this tool several times a day every day. it is like an extension of my hands. I am amazed every day how handy this thing is. can do everything from fix a screen door, write a note, or pull a splinter. the scissors and blades are nearly surgical quality. if you don't have this model I urge you to buy one to see for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Go Illini

customer_reviews.title: Magnifying glass fell apart within a month.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was pretty cool, and it's what my husband wanted for his birthday. The magnifying glass broke within the first month he had it. I hope it's just a glitch, and the rest of it will work and last as long as his other knife did. He really finds uses for all of the gadgets, and he likes that it's black. Black goes with everything!
customer_reviews.author: Barb Luongo

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate Swiss Army Knife, and in Black
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for the ultimate all purpose SAK that's still small enough to carry in a pocket, this is it. This model has been around (under various model names) for around 30+ years and is still made to the highest quality standards. That's impressive. If you're looking to give a young person a SAK they will always love and never outgrow, this is the one. The black is a nice distinctive touch. If you're looking for most of the features of this knife but in a slimmer frame look at the Victorinox 'Explorer' model also. But this is a great, great knife that I use every day. Thank you Victorinox.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've owned one for 40+ years. The only time I have to get another is when someone helped himself to my knife. This time I also got one for my daughter. Unless something is perfect she'll archive it away. She loves, uses it, and actually show it off to her friends. I've few with various tools. This one for me has just the right number of tools and so I have it with me all over. My advice to my daughter, and novices, was - do spend a little time to learn various functions from their site.
customer_reviews.author: B. Khozai

customer_reviews.title: Be careful for what you wish for
customer_reviews.text: I think I bargained more than what I wanted the additional Accessories and bulkiness Makes it hard to carry around however the quality of the tools are exceptional
customer_reviews.author: Henriquez Family

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife with lots of practical tools!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic multi tool. It’s my everyday carry goto tool. Can’t praise it enough. Hand made Swiss quality, lifetime warranty. Can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Swiss army knives are the best multi use tools in the world
customer_reviews.author: David Zimdars

customer_reviews.title: Victorianox swiss champ army knife. 10 stars 😊
customer_reviews.text: If I give give this a ten star rating I would. It is a very nice gadget victorionox swiss army knife. The knife is very sharp, cuts cardboard like paper and cuts paper like butter. Sturdy well made suitable for anyone who is a tinkerer or outdoors man. Blade reads at base officer suisse on one side and the other side it reads victorianocox swiss made stainless. Reason I mention that is because I've seen posts about this swiss army knife being fake...this is not a fake knife it is very well made and very useful. A store full of tools and uses for them. Thank you for this work of art
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool - Bad Key Chain
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it five stars but the key chain that it comes on is thin and tiny relative to the large heavy knife. And it doesn’t seem to me that it could fit on a bigger key chain. In all other senses the gift recipient is really enjoying its many many features.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: One day the lense of the magnifying glass was just gone. Frame intact but no lense. Wonder if manufacturer would extend their warranty period at bit longer ?
customer_reviews.author: Ben Cashman

customer_reviews.title: Very good knife overall
customer_reviews.text: Very good knife overall. Has all the promised features and the metals are sharp. I like how the parts click when you close them. Also really slick design too. Only negative is that you can see some of the glue flooding through the cracks of the different knife parts. Not a big deal but the glue can be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Best “Swiss Army” knife ever made.
customer_reviews.text: Just as good as they have always been. It’s unfortunate they don’t make a good case but there is currently some top leather cases being made in a shop out of Ukraine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Loves Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality - Just be sure its real!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed the first time when we ordered this and received a counterfeit from an Amazon seller, but after a refund and reordering through Amazon LLC we received the real deal. This is a very nice knife. High quality with easy to open gadgets. Just be sure you're getting a genuine Victorinox because what you see in the picture is not necessarily what you'll get. It should be stamped Victorinox on the main blade. Many sites show you how to tell if it is real and there is definitely a big quality difference between this on and the cheap look alike.
customer_reviews.author: V. Splann

customer_reviews.title: My best Friend!
customer_reviews.text: Every woman should have one. How many times it has come in handy at work, home and outdoors. Also on evenings, I'm out late and I am walking home alone, I hold it in my hand with the knife part out for protection, sometimes the city streets can be a bit challenging.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Oh yeah!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Right size , weight , tools for everything. This is a item that will last you a life time and pass down to someone else. Office to field and back to home it does it all. If your looking for that “just right” SAK this is that “one”.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Cook

customer_reviews.title: Its the real swiss army knife
customer_reviews.text: Made sure its real by reading the writing on the main blade it suppose to say Victorinox if it doesnt its fake...the only thing i miss is the old magnafying glass the lens is alright but the glass was the best...overall i just love my swisschamp thanks amazon💯
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Garcia

customer_reviews.title: I always loved the Swiss Army knife
customer_reviews.text: Great tool I keep it with me at all times. Got to give it to the Swiss army to be prepared. Never know when you have to pop a beer or bottle or wine, while slicing some cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Masterhvacr

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have around
customer_reviews.text: I used this tool to fix a broken radiator hose on my friends car when she was stranded at the university. Always something one should keep around.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Pulkkinen

customer_reviews.title: The mother of all pocket knives
customer_reviews.text: It's got virtually everything you'll need. Bulky, but I still keep it in my pocket while camping because I'm always reaching for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Useful/Resource tool(s)
customer_reviews.text: Has the multiple functions as described above; Bought this with the help of reviews of each functionality. A good first buy for this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Different color same great multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had lost my Swiss Army knife so I ordered this new one. I had always owned red ones and liked the sapphire blue color when I saw this on Amazon. Something different and will make it easier to figure out which is mine if someone borrows it. And this one has the plier tool in addition to everything else mine had. It is a little bit larger but still fits (tightly) in my belt pouch. I ended up finding my old knife but gave it to my daughter who said she always wanted one. I kept this blue one. :-)
customer_reviews.author: M. Dodel

customer_reviews.title: Finally replaced my 30 year old Swisschamp
customer_reviews.text: replaced my 30 year old swisschamp due to melting the bolsters with solvent. i use my knife nearly every day. fantastic item. this model is a good balance for all your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Rex A. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and so many functions!
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely amazing pocket knife! Has so many functions. This is really useful, seems very sturdy and I would definitely buy it as a gift for someone!
customer_reviews.author: book lover

customer_reviews.title: It’s genuine Swiss army
customer_reviews.text: It’s genuine Swiss army, quality is the best has been over a hundred years! A review really almost redundant! But it is the best quality
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Holston

customer_reviews.title: Happy!!!
customer_reviews.text: It was a Mother’s Day gift to replace the one I bought my Mom 24 yrs ago that she lost and she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, would recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Another great product. Love everything about this one. My only gripe is about the price though, as it could have been a bit lower.
customer_reviews.author: Vjstormer

customer_reviews.title: Best knife you'll ever own or need
customer_reviews.text: The knife is great all functions work as they should the blue color is beautiful it's now my favorite knife I have quite a collection
customer_reviews.author: Dale

product_meta.title: Victorinox Swiss Army Multi-Tool, SwissChamp Pocket Knife
product_meta.description:
"ULTIMATE COMPANION 
From housework to camping adventures, the 3.6"" SwissChamp comes prepared for any situation. Featuring 33 tools, stainless steel construction, and Swiss-Made precision, the SwissChamp is the essential handy helper for anyone, anywhere. 

FEATURES 33 FUNCTIONS: 
Large blade; small blade; corkscrew; can opener with a small screwdriver (also for Phillips screws); bottle opener with a large screwdriver and wire stripper; reamer; key ring; tweezers; toothpick; scissors; multipurpose hook; wood saw; fish scaler with a hook disgorger and ruler (in/cm); nail file with a nail cleaner, metal file, and metal saw; fine screwdriver (2.5mm); chisel/scraper; pliers with a wire cutter and wire crimper; Phillips screwdriver; magnifying lens; pressurized ballpoint pen; straight pin; patented mini-screwdriver; and sewing eye. 

CARE TIPS FOR YOUR SWISS ARMY KNIFE 
The steel is tempered, annealed and polished to achieve the necessary hardness and provide optimum resistance to corrosion. 

SHARPENING 
To re-sharpen your knife, use a whetstone at an angle of 15°– 20°. This will result in a cutting angle of 30°– 40°. If sharpening on a grinding wheel, always cool with plenty of water to avoid excessive temperatures and the resulting damages that may occur. 

CLEANING 
If the blades of knife begin to stick together, open and close the blades in warm water several times - this will allow the tools to move easily again. Once dry, apply a drop of Swiss Army Knife Oil between each tool and its spring. Do not put Swiss Army Knives in the dishwasher. 

HISTORY & HERITAGE 
In 1884, Master Cutler Karl Elsener opened a cutlery shop in Ibach, Switzerland. There, he and his cutlers’ union produced the finest steel cutlery, finished with the now-famous proprietary edge preferred globally by professionals and home cooks. Karl supplied the Swiss Army with its standard issue Soldier’s Knife and Officer’s Knife. After the death of his mother, and with the advent of stainless steel, Karl changed the name of the company to Victorinox. It is from those humble beginnings that a worldwide icon was born. Today, Victorinox is still owned and operated by the Elsener family, and both the company and family still resides in the small village of Ibach, Switzerland."
feature_bullets: READY FOR WHATEVER, WHENEVER. Features (33) functions including: 2.45" blade, Phillips screwdriver, bottle opener with screwdriver, pliers and a corkscrew – this multi-tool can be used whether you're deep in the wilderness or doing jobs around the house.
DURABLE CONSTRUCTION. Swiss Made stainless steel construction encased in polished black ABS scales provides sleek durability.
COMPACT CARRY. Be prepared for whatever your adventures bring - With a tool for nearly every task, the SwissChamp pocket knife is like having a tool box in your pocket.
KNIFE DIMENSIONS. Length: 3.6” (91mm), Height: 1.3”, Weight: 6.5 oz.
TRUSTED QUALITY. Made in Switzerland; Victorinox provides a lifetime guarantee against defects in material and workmanship. Making a lifetime commitment has never been so easy.
